channel.title: Twitter Bootstrap on Damien Saunders
channel.description: Recent content in Twitter Bootstrap on Damien Saunders

item.title: Isotope Visual Layouts Pro plugin for WordPress switches to Twitter Bootstrap
item.description: Isotope Visual Layouts Pro WordPress plugin is easier to use now that it’s using the Twitter Bootstrap framework with great CSS options and features. Damien’s WordPress plugins have great features that mean you can improve your website and not change your theme. This is ideal for a designer or developer who wants to change the look n feel via custom CSS. Overtime, I’ve come to realise that most people download or buy the plugin on the basis off the look.

item.title: Isotope Visual Layouts for WordPress & Twitter Bootstrap
Axure & Twitter Bootstrap - Added split button drop-up (now on BitBucket)
item.description: Small but important update for my Axure Twitter Bootstrap Widget Library. It’s now got the recently added Split-Button drop-up and I’ve hosted it on BitBucket. Linkage Download latest release from Bitbucket

item.title: Axure - Create Scroll Spy and Sticky Nav Bars like Twitter Bootstrap
item.description: Have you seen Twitter Bootstrapand liked scrollspy javascript? Perhaps you want to use it in Axure to create floating navbars and sticky toolbars? Are you impressed by Twitter Bootstrap? Some are, some aren’t - but I don’t know what the fuss is about - if you’ve got an amazing framework that is responsive and ready to go for your next startup - what’s not to love about it? It saves some design time and some development time.
